segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Catherine.
And today we've got a lesson for you that's about an unusual topic, something we've never talked about here on EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节课要给你们，主题是一个不寻常的话题，这是我们在EnglishPod从未讨论过的。

segments.en: That's right.

As you know, in EnglishPod, we like to talk about all sorts of topics, especially topics that are real-life topics, so probably a lot of things that you won't find in your normal English notebooks or English learning books.
segments.cn: 正如你所知，在EnglishPod，我们喜欢讨论各种话题，尤其是现实生活中的话题，所以可能有很多内容你在普通的英语笔记本或英语学习书中找不到。

segments.en: That's right.
So we want to tell you in advance, today's lesson is about drugs.
segments.cn: 所以我们想提前告诉你，今天的课程是关于毒品的。

segments.en: So if you're a younger user or you have kids, maybe they shouldn't listen to today's lesson, but you're going to learn a lot of the names for drugs and also how to turn down an offer of drugs.
segments.cn: 如果你是年轻用户或者有孩子，可能他们不应该听今天的课程，但你会学到很多毒品的名称，以及如何拒绝毒品的提议。

segments.en: So let's check out today's dialogue, and we'll be back in a moment to talk about the things that you've heard.
segments.cn: 让我们来看看今天的对话，稍后我们会回来讨论你听到的内容。

segments.en: Hey, man, you want to buy some weed?
segments.cn: 嘿，兄弟，你想买点大麻吗？

segments.en: Some what?
Weed.
You know, pot, ganja, Mary Jane, some chronic.
segments.cn: 你知道的，草，甘蔗，玛丽·简，慢性。

segments.en: Oh, uh, no thanks.
I also have blow if you prefer to do a few lines.
segments.cn: 如果你喜欢，我还有可卡因。

segments.en: No, I'm okay.
Really.
Come on, man.
I even got dope and acid.
segments.cn: 我甚至还有毒品和迷幻药。

segments.en: Try some.
Do you really have all of these drugs?
Where do you get them from?
I got my connections.
Just tell me what you want, and I'll even give you an ounce for free.
segments.cn: 只要告诉我你想要什么，我甚至可以给你一盎司的免费。

segments.en: Hmm, sounds good.
Let's see.
I want... Yeah?
I want you to put your hands behind your head.
segments.cn: 我想让你把手放在头后面。

segments.en: You are under arrest.
Dope!
Alright, we're back.
So as Catherine mentioned, obviously, everywhere in the world, maybe most likely you've been offered drugs.
segments.cn: 正如Catherine提到的，显然，在世界各地，你可能都被提供过毒品。

segments.en: So we're not only going to talk about drugs, but we're also going to give you some vocab in English how to reject or turn down the offer of drugs.
segments.cn: 所以我们不仅会讨论毒品，还会给你一些英语词汇，教你如何拒绝或拒绝毒品的提议。

segments.en: And now what we're going to take a look at, let's start in Language Takeaway with some of the names of these drugs in English.
segments.cn: 现在我们要看看的是，让我们在语言收获中开始一些这些毒品的英语名称。

segments.en: Okay, so we're in Language Takeaway here, and I want to warn you, some of these words are slang.
segments.cn: 好的，我们在语言收获中，我想警告你，这些词有些是俚语。

segments.en: That means they're not words from like a dictionary.
segments.cn: 这意味着它们不是字典中的词。

segments.en: These are words people use when they're talking to each other in daily life, or words that you hear on the street.
segments.cn: 这些是人们在日常生活中互相交流时使用的词，或者是你在街上听到的词。

segments.en: That's right.
You may even hear them a lot in movies as well.
segments.cn: 你甚至可能在电影中听到它们。

segments.en: Movies and TV.
So this first one, weed, is something... there's even a TV show called Weeds.
segments.cn: 所以第一个，草，是……甚至有一部叫《杂草》的电视剧。

segments.en: That's right, that talks about this topic.
So weed is the street name or the most common name for the drug marijuana.
segments.cn: 所以草是毒品大麻的街头名称或最常见的名称。

segments.en: That's right.
Marijuana is the drug name, but there are many, many, many other names in English that you'll hear.
segments.cn: 大麻是药物名称，但在英语中还有很多其他名称你会听到。

segments.en: So weed is one of them.
A weed is a kind of thing that grows, like grass or a flower that you cut because you don't want it.
segments.cn: 草是一种生长的东西，比如你因为不想要而割掉的草或花。

segments.en: It's bad, it smells bad.
segments.cn: 它是坏的，闻起来很糟糕。

segments.en: That's right, that's exactly right.
So the colloquial name for marijuana is weed, and obviously the person that's being offered these drugs doesn't understand what that means.
segments.cn: 所以大麻的口语名称是草，显然被提供这些毒品的人并不理解这是什么意思。

segments.en: So he goes on and he gives a couple of different other street names for the same drug.
segments.cn: 所以他继续给出几个其他的同类毒品的街头名称。

segments.en: So the first one... so the next one is pot.
segments.cn: 所以第一个……下一个是锅。

segments.en: That's right.
So he says pot or ganja or Mary Jane or even chronic.
segments.cn: 所以他说锅或甘蔗或玛丽·简或甚至慢性。

segments.en: So all of these are synonyms.
They mean exactly the same thing.
They all mean marijuana.
Okay, but then after that, the drug dealer offers other kinds of drugs.
segments.cn: 好的，但之后，毒贩提供了其他种类的毒品。

segments.en: He says blow.
So now we may know the verb to blow, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们可能知道动词“吹”，对吧？

segments.en: That's right, to blow air.
But in this case, it's a noun.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，它是一个名词。

segments.en: Okay, so he says, I have blow.
segments.cn: 好的，所以他说，我有可卡因。

segments.en: That's right.
So he's offering this drug called blow.
segments.cn: 所以他在提供这种叫做可卡因的毒品。

segments.en: And what is blow?
Blow is the street name for cocaine.
segments.cn: 可卡因是可卡因的街头名称。

segments.en: So there's a very famous movie called Blow, and it was about selling cocaine.
segments.cn: 所以有一部非常著名的电影叫《可卡因》，讲的是贩卖可卡因。

segments.en: Now, so after he talks about having blow, he also says, if you want to do a few lines.
segments.cn: 现在，在他谈到有可卡因之后，他还说，如果你想吸几条线。

segments.en: And so this is what you'll commonly hear people saying how they do this drug.
segments.cn: 这就是你常听到人们说他们如何使用这种毒品。

segments.en: That's right.
So for example, you may know that many drugs, they're consumed in different ways.
segments.cn: 例如，你可能知道许多毒品以不同的方式消费。

segments.en: For example, weed.
People smoke it, right?
In this case, when we're talking about cocaine or blow, then that's why he refers to do a few lines.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，当我们谈论可卡因或可卡因时，这就是为什么他提到吸几条线。

segments.en: All right, because people breathe it in through their nose.
segments.cn: 好的，因为人们通过鼻子吸入它。

segments.en: That's right.
So that's the colloquial way of saying of how you say that how you consume this drug.
segments.cn: 所以这就是口语中说你如何消费这种毒品的方式。

segments.en: Okay, so moving along, there's two more drugs that got mentioned in today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，继续，今天的对话中提到了另外两种毒品。

segments.en: They're dope and acid.
Now dope can mean two different things.
segments.cn: 现在毒品可以有两种不同的意思。

segments.en: Sometimes it means marijuana, like some of those other words we heard earlier.
segments.cn: 有时它指的是大麻，就像我们之前听到的一些其他词。

segments.en: But sometimes it also means a very, very serious drug called crack cocaine.
segments.cn: 但有时它也指一种非常严重的毒品，叫做裂解可卡因。

segments.en: Okay, and that's something that people breathe in.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一种人们吸入的东西。

segments.en: And it's very, very addictive.
segments.cn: 而且它是非常非常上瘾的。

segments.en: Yeah, that's right.
And also the other word that we have there or the other drug acid, you may know the word acid is a very harmful substance.
segments.cn: 还有我们提到的另一个词或另一种毒品迷幻药，你可能知道迷幻药是非常有害的物质。

segments.en: Like, for example, batteries.
They have a certain type of acid that, for example, will melt metal or if it gets on your skin, it will burn you.
segments.cn: 它们有一种特定类型的酸，例如，可以融化金属，或者如果它接触到你的皮肤，会烧伤你。

segments.en: That's right.
But acid, when it's a drug, means LSD.
segments.cn: 但当迷幻药作为一种毒品时，指的是LSD。

segments.en: And that is a drug that people take that makes them see things.
segments.cn: 这是一种人们服用的药物，会让他们看到东西。

segments.en: So it's called a hallucinogenic.
It makes you see crazy things and it was very, very popular in the 1970s.
segments.cn: 它让你看到疯狂的东西，在1970年代非常流行。

segments.en: That's right.
So that's acid or LSD.
Very good.
So we've taken a look at a lot of vocab here, specifically all the drugs.
segments.cn: 我们已经看了很多词汇，特别是所有的毒品。

segments.en: Why don't we go back to our dialogue?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回到我们的对话中呢？

segments.en: Let's take another listen and we'll be back to talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一遍，然后再回来聊聊。

segments.en: Oh, uh, no thanks.
I also have blow if you prefer to do a few lines.
segments.cn: 如果你想吸几条，我也有可卡因。

segments.en: No, I'm okay.
Really.
Come on, man.
I even got dope and acid.
Try some.
Do you really have all of these drugs?
Where do you get them from?
I got my connections.
Just tell me what you want and I'll even give you an ounce for free.
segments.cn: 只要告诉我你想要什么，我甚至可以给你一盎司免费。

segments.en: Hmm.
Sounds good.
Let's see.
I want... Yeah?
I want you to put your hands behind your head.
segments.cn: 我想让你把手放在头后面。

segments.en: You are under arrest.
Don't!
Okay, so now in Fluency Builder, we've got a couple of phrases for you about the other side of things.
segments.cn: 好的，现在在流利构建器中，我们有几个短语关于事情的另一面。

segments.en: How to say no to drugs and what you might hear from a police officer like we hear in today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 如何对毒品说不，以及你可能会听到的警察说的话，就像我们在今天的对话中听到的。

segments.en: That's right.
So let's take a look at these phrases in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 所以让我们看看流利构建器中的这些短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
So the first one we hear is no thanks.
segments.cn: 我们听到的第一个是“不用了”。

segments.en: So the guy says no thanks.
He doesn't want the drugs.
That's right.
So obviously you're being offered something that you don't like.
segments.cn: 所以显然你被提供了你不喜欢的东西。

segments.en: Let's take into consideration drugs or maybe somebody wants to offer you a drink or somebody wants to take you on a date.
segments.cn: 让我们考虑毒品，或者也许有人想请你喝一杯，或者有人想约你。

segments.en: You can say no thanks.
No thanks.
So, hey Marco, you want a drink?
segments.cn: 所以，嘿，马尔科，你想喝一杯吗？

segments.en: I'm gonna go right now.
It's only like two o'clock, but you know we could go for a drink.
segments.cn: 现在才两点，但你知道我们可以去喝一杯。

segments.en: No thanks.
No.
Oh, okay.
Right.
And now we also have another phrase.
segments.cn: 现在我们还有另一个短语。

segments.en: If a person insists, the person is continually insisting like, oh, come on, come on.
segments.cn: 如果一个人坚持，那个人人不断坚持，比如，哦，来吧，来吧。

segments.en: Come on, Marco.
Let's go for a drink.
I really want a drink.
Come with me.
Right.
And you can say, no, I'm okay.
Really.
So it may sound confusing.
segments.cn: 所以这可能听起来令人困惑。

segments.en: I am okay.
Because that would mean you're in good health.
segments.cn: 因为这意味着你身体健康。

segments.en: I feel good.
I feel good.
But in this case, when you say to someone, no, I'm okay, you're saying, no, I'm fine the way I am.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，当你对某人说“不，我没事”，你是在说，不，我现在很好。

segments.en: I don't really need to do anything.
I don't need it.
So I'm okay means I don't need it.
segments.cn: 所以我没事意味着我不需要它。

segments.en: All right.
And this is a great way to really say, listen, no, I don't want it.
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的方式来真正说，听着，不，我不想要。

segments.en: Okay.
So those are the two ways that we have in which you can say no.
segments.cn: 所以这是我们可以说不的两种方式。

segments.en: We're going to give you a couple of more towards the end of the lesson.
segments.cn: 我们将在课程结束时给你几个更多的短语。

segments.en: But let's take a look very quickly at our next phrase.
segments.cn: 但让我们快速看看下一个短语。

segments.en: When the police officer said, you are under arrest.
All right.
So the man didn't know the person didn't know this was a police officer.
segments.cn: 所以那个人不知道这是警察。

segments.en: And finally, in the end, he says, you are under arrest.
That's right.
Okay.
So this is something you hear in the movies when they put the handcuffs on somebody.
segments.cn: 所以这是你在电影中听到的，当他们给某人戴上手铐时。

segments.en: The preposition is under.
It's strange, but you just have to remember this as a phrase.
segments.cn: 这很奇怪，但你只需记住这个短语。

segments.en: You are under arrest.
I am arresting you.
That means you are going to the police station with me.
segments.cn: 这意味着你要和我去警察局。

segments.en: You broke the law.
Right.
Or you can say, Oh, Tim is under arrest.
segments.cn: 或者你可以说，哦，蒂姆被逮捕了。

segments.en: He's at the police station right now.
Okay.
All right.
So we've taken a look at a couple of phrases and a couple of different things.
segments.cn: 所以我们看了一些短语和不同的内容。

segments.en: Why don't we take another short break?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不再休息一下？

segments.en: Let's listen to our dialogue and we'll be back in a moment.
segments.cn: 让我们听听我们的对话，稍后再回来。

segments.en: Hey, man, you want to buy some weed?
segments.cn: 嘿，兄弟，你想买点大麻吗？

segments.en: Some what?
Weed.
You know, pot, ganja, Mary Jane, some chronic.
segments.cn: 你知道，草，甘草，玛丽·简，一些慢性药物。

segments.en: Oh, uh, no thanks.
I also have blow if you prefer to do a few lines.
segments.cn: 如果你想吸几条，我也有可卡因。

segments.en: No, I'm okay, really.
Come on, man.
I even got dope and acid.
Try some.
Do you really have all of these drugs?
segments.cn: 你真的有所有这些药物吗？

segments.en: Where do you get them from?
I got my connections.
Just tell me what you want and I'll even give you a nouns for free.
segments.cn: 只要告诉我你想要什么，我甚至可以免费给你一些名词。

segments.en: Hmm.
Sounds good.
Let's see.
I want.
Yeah.
I want you to put your hands behind your head.
segments.cn: 我想让你把手放在头后面。

segments.en: You are under arrest.
All right.
So obviously a very serious topic, but at the same time, I think very necessary because it may happen or you may hear it in a movie and it's part of the English language.
segments.cn: 这显然是一个非常严肃的话题，但同时我认为非常必要，因为这可能会发生，或者你可能在电影中听到，这是英语的一部分。

segments.en: Now, obviously we are not advocating or saying that drugs are good or anything.
segments.cn: 现在，显然我们并不是在提倡或说毒品是好的。

segments.en: We are saying we are giving you the tools so you know how to recognize when somebody is offering you a drug and the way that you can say no.
segments.cn: 我们是说我们给你工具，让你知道如何识别有人在给你提供毒品，以及你可以如何拒绝。

segments.en: That's right.
So remember that these are things that you might hear when you're in a country like America or England or Australia.
segments.cn: 所以记住，这些是你在美国、英国或澳大利亚这样的国家可能会听到的事情。

segments.en: We hope that you don't have to worry about this, but if you do hear it or you hear it in a movie, you will understand it.
segments.cn: 我们希望你不必担心这个，但如果你听到它，或者在电影中听到，你会理解。

segments.en: But Marker, we had some other ways to say no to drugs, right?
segments.cn: 但是Marker，我们还有其他拒绝毒品的方法，对吧？

segments.en: To say no to something, to refuse.
So we heard no thanks and I'm okay.
segments.cn: 我们听到“不，谢谢”和“我没事”。

segments.en: But what are some other ways to say no?
segments.cn: 但还有什么其他拒绝的方法？

segments.en: Well, for example, if the person also persists or insists, you can say no, I'm good.
segments.cn: 嗯，例如，如果那个人还在坚持，你可以说“不，我很好”。

segments.en: Thank you.
I'm good.
Yeah.
So it doesn't really make sense because you're saying I'm good.
segments.cn: 所以这并不太合理，因为你在说“我很好”。

segments.en: What does that exactly mean?
So like Marco, you want a cigarette?
No, I'm good.
Thanks.
Okay.
So that's a way of saying no thanks.
segments.cn: 所以这是一种拒绝的方式。

segments.en: No, thanks.
I'm also I'm cool.
Not saying like, I'm really cool, right?
segments.cn: 不是说，我真的很好，对吧？

segments.en: It's like saying no, I'm good.
segments.cn: 这就像是在说“不，我很好”。

segments.en: I'm cool.
Thanks.
That's right.
I'm cool.
I'm thank you.
No, thank you.
Or as well, you can also just say no, thank you.
segments.cn: 或者你也可以直接说“不，谢谢”。

segments.en: I think the most clear is no, I don't smoke or no, I don't do drugs.
segments.cn: 我认为最清楚的是“不，我不抽烟”或“不，我不吸毒”。

segments.en: Yes, exactly.
That's the, that's the verb that we use when referring to drugs.
segments.cn: 这就是我们在提到毒品时使用的动词。

segments.en: You do drugs.
You don't do drugs.
So he does drugs or don't do drugs.
You often hear this phrase, so you can say, listen, no, no, thank you.
segments.cn: 你经常听到这个短语，所以你可以说，听着，不，不，谢谢。

segments.en: I'm cool.
I don't do drugs.
That's right.
So, as we said, this is all the kind of street slaying or colloquial, very common ways of referring to drugs in English.
segments.cn: 所以，正如我们所说，这都是街头俚语或口语中非常常见的提到毒品的方式。

segments.en: So you can keep an eye out for that.
If you hear that in movies now, you know more or less what they're referring to.
segments.cn: 如果你在电影中听到这些，现在你大致知道他们在指什么。

segments.en: And also, of course, if you have any questions, any comments or any suggestions, we are always available on our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 当然，如果你有任何问题、评论或建议，我们始终在我们的网站EnglishPod.com上提供帮助。

segments.en: We hope to see you guys there.
segments.cn: 我们希望在那儿见到你们。

segments.en: And until next time, bye.
